bill_title: repeal certain statutes and references regarding obsolete accounting funds.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to repeal certain statutes and references regarding obsolete accounting funds. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 10-39A-8 be amended to read as follows: 10-39A-8. All taxes, interest and penalties imposed and collected by the secretary of revenue and regulation under this chapter shall be distributed as follows: (1) One-half shall be returned to the county in which the energy minerals or mineral products were severed; (2) One-sixth shall be paid into the state treasury and credited to the energy development impact fund; (3) One-third One-half share shall be paid into the state treasury and credited to the general fund. Section 2. That § 10-39A-8.1 be repealed. 10-39A-8.1. There is hereby created a special fund within the state treasury to be known as the energy development impact fund for the purpose of offsetting economic, social, and physical impacts resulting from energy development and production. The state investment officer is responsible for the investment of the energy impact funds. Expenditures from the fund shall be made only by special appropriations bills passed by the Legislature. All money in the fund shall be budgeted and expended in accordance with chapters 4-7, 4-8, 4-8A, and 4-8B. Section 3. That § 10-39A-8.2 be repealed. 10-39A-8.2. The dollar balance in the energy impact fund shall not exceed one hundred thousand dollars. Any excess over one hundred thousand dollars shall be credited to the state general fund. Section 4. That § 13-14-12 be repealed. 13-14-12. Grants may be awarded to local projects benefiting at-risk youth including early identification, early childhood projects, parental involvement projects, prevention awareness initiatives, substance abuse prevention, career exploration and vocational education projects, school-to-work transition projects, health and medical services programs, effective schools projects, mental health services, family-based services, institutional care, and juvenile aftercare. The Department of Education shall publish notice of availability outlining the application procedures, deadlines, and award procedures. Awards shall be based on the quality of the proposal's program description including goals and objectives, the organizational structure, operating schedule, service criteria, the expertise of involved personnel, outlined performance outcomes, coordination with other agencies, and projected budget. Section 5. That § 13-47-22 be repealed. 13-47-22. The secretary of education, through an internal service fund, is empowered to offer elementary and secondary instructional services to school districts outside the boundaries of this state provided, however, that such services will only be provided on payment of an appropriate charge to recover the proportionate share of such programming. Section 6. That § 13-47-23 be repealed. 13-47-23. Receipts for the sale of guides and other related material shall be placed in the internal service fund created by § 13-47-22. Section 7. That § 1-44-7.2 be repealed. 1-44-7.2. There is hereby created a special fund known as the public and special transportation assistance fund. All money in the public transportation and special assistance fund shall be used for assisting South Dakota communities with a portion of the current match level and additional match required to participate in the federal funding of public transportation. The fund shall be administered by the Department of Transportation. Expenditures authorized shall be paid on warrants drawn by the state auditor on vouchers approved by the secretary of the Department of Transportation. Section 8. That § 1-44-7.3 be amended to read as follows: 1-44-7.3. The Transportation Commission shall promulgate rules pursuant to chapter 1-26 for administration, terms, and conditions for the disbursements of money to local communities and to establish criteria for the selection of communities to receive such subsidy from the public transportation assistance fund . Section 9. That § 13-14-7 be repealed. 13-14-7. For the benefit of the people of the State of South Dakota and the improvement of this and future generations of youth, it is essential that all of our youth be given the fullest opportunity to learn and to develop their intellect and their skills to become productive and contributing members of society. Each year a number of our young people fail to complete the essentials of learning and thereby become a burden to the rest of society. During the first hundred years of statehood, South Dakota and its citizens have been committed to education as fundamental to the success of the state and its people. We must expand this commitment during the next one hundred years of statehood to make sure that all of our state's young people are trained and ready to achieve economic and social self-sufficiency. Sections 13-14-6 to 13-14-12, inclusive, are intended to provide an ongoing measure of assistance and alternative methods for projects which will benefit the present and future generations of youths most apt to fail in completing the essentials of learning. Section 10. That § 13-14-8.1 be repealed. 13-14-8.1. Grants under § 13-14-8 may be awarded to school districts for projects that will work toward the goal of reducing class sizes for students in kindergarten through grade three to fifteen or less students per classroom. Grants shall be awarded over a period not to exceed three years. The Department of Education shall publish notice of availability outlining the application procedures, deadlines, and award procedures. Awards shall be based on the quality of the proposal's program description including goals and objectives, the organizational structure, operating schedule, degree of youth at risk potential, the expertise of involved personnel, outlined performance outcomes, coordination with the current school program, and projected budget. Section 11. That § 13-14-9 be repealed. 13-14-9. Any general funds appropriated to the Department of Education for special projects funds shall be distributed as provided in SL 1990, ch 190, § 4 and § 13-14-12. If appropriated funds are insufficient to fund the distributions, the available funds shall be distributed on a pro-rata basis.
